meanings.sent1: The farmer gathered the sheafs of wheat after the harvest.
meanings.sent2: The sheafs of barley stood tall in the field, ready for threshing.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used the sheafs as a hiding spot for its acorns.
meanings.sent4: The sheafs of corn swayed gently in the breeze, like a golden sea.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the sheafs against the setting sun was truly picturesque.

meanings.definition: A group or collection of things gathered together
meanings.sent1: She carefully organized the sheafs of papers on her desk.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed a fascinating collection of sheafs from different cultures.
meanings.sent3: The children created sheafs of colorful leaves as part of their art project.
meanings.sent4: The sheafs of books on the shelves seemed to whisper stories of the past.
meanings.sent5: The sheafs of clouds in the sky painted a beautiful scene above.
